results.title: Elaine Dale: on mine own
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TV Eye”.
This film is about the inspiring story of Elaine Dale, born without arms - as a result of a side effect of the drug Thalidomide - and now married with one child. Elaine speaks of her own personal struggle to live an independent life while her parents tell of their battle with the drug company for adequate compensation as well as the difficulties encountered in rearing Elaine.

results.title: El Pueblo
results.brief_description: Depicts life in the small community of Villaleunga del Rosario, set high in the mountains of Andalucia in Spain. The village is sustained by the farms which surround it and a modest workshop manufacturing leather goods. The farms are small, often arid and far from the village itself, providing a meagre living from cattle, sheep and goats. But the sense of community is strong, the people’s enduring allegiance and identity being with the village in which they live.

results.title: El Dorado
results.creator_credit: Argosy-Crown Film Unit and John Alderson
results.brief_description: A travelogue of British Guiana describing the three natural divisions of the country, its peoples and its industries, and the way in which it is being developed.

results.title: El Barrio
results.creator_credit: David Sureck, UNICEF and Norton Heilig
results.brief_description: Mario Mendoza, age 7, lives in a city dump in Mexico City. We see a day in Mario’s life. The Mexican Government, with aid from UNICEF, plans to help people-like Mario-who are living in such squalid conditions

results.title: Eisenstein: a biography
results.brief_description: Surveys the films of Russian director Sergei Eisenstein, by presenting extracts from six of his films, with introductory notes (there is no commentary on the soundtrack). These extracts are used as examples to emphasise Eisenstein’s technique of “montage”. The first extract is from BATTLESHIP POTEMKIN (showing the sequence where Vakulinchuk is being mourned as he lies on the mole, after having been shot by an officer during the mutiny on the Potemkin). Other extracts are from OCTOBER (Kerensky mounting the stairs and entering the Royal apartments); THE GENERAL LINE, THE OLD AND THE NEW (Marfa attempting to plough with her cow); TIME IN THE SUN (the funeral sequence from the first episode); ALEXANDER NEVSKY (the beginning of the battle on ice); IVAN THE TERRIBLE (at the end of the film where the people of Moscow beg Ivan to return). This film is compiled by Marie Seton

results.title: Eisenhower
results.brief_description: A biography of former President Eisenhower covering his experiences during World War II, his presidency at Columbia University, the formation of NATO, his visit to Korea and his years in the White House.

results.title: Eire
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Arthur Guest
results.brief_description: Class-room film on the geography and economy of Eire. Scenes of the western coastal region of county Mayo and Galway; the River Shannon and the hydro-electric scheme; the machine-cut turf from the Bog of Allen and the turf-fired power station at Port Arlington; the making of cream and butter from the milk of the Golden Vale. Final sequences show great ports and centres of trade in Eire.

results.title: Einstein: the story of the man by his friends
results.brief_description: A biographical documentary dealing with the life and work of Albert Einstein using historical footage and interviews with friends and colleagues. The film explores Einstein’s childhood, education, work, migration and political beliefs. His theories are explained using simple, unscientific terms. Tragically, despite his pacifism, Einstein’s work was instrumental in the creation of the atomic bomb. Includes footage of Einstein with Charlie Chaplin, at a ceremony in his honour hosted by George Bernard Shaw, visiting California between the wars and receiving a Nobel prize. It also contains historical footage of the World Wars including the burning of books by the Nazi party and attacks on Jewish homes and businesses. Narrated by John Stockbridge. Photographed by Eugene Carr, Len Newson and Tony Leggo. Edited by Ted Walter.

results.title: Eikon
results.brief_description: An experimental film with triple image effects done in the camera using a matte-box. The central image was filmed after the two side sections - the side sections being shot in a random way and no record kept of the various shots. Colour filters were used with the camera and not in the laboratory. The subject reminded the filmmakers of faces and figures in old icons, the triptych structure of the images also echoes the icon. An interesting blend of stillness, movement, rocks, flesh, woman, girl, water, sky, colour, light, wind, sun and foliage.

results.title: Eighteenth century England: people and places
results.brief_description: Neoclassicism, romanticism, rebellion and adventure are some of the facets of the eighteenth century shown, by this film, through paintings by Hogarth and Gainsborough, the architecture of famous English house, sculpture, figurines, and scenes of navigation instruments and ships. These are used to illustrate the lives and ideas of both aristocrats and commoners in eighteenth-century England.
